algorithm_technique: Greedy approach using counts of greater elements and array lengths
Binary Indexed Tree (Fenwick Tree) or Segment Tree for efficient counts
problem_summary_simple: Distribute numbers based on counts of greater elements in two arrays and their lengths.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a data structure (like SortedList) to efficiently count elements greater than a value in each array.
key_insights: The core of the problem is efficiently calculating `greaterCount(arr, val)`.
A sorted data structure (like `SortedList` or a Fenwick tree) is essential for efficient counting.
The tie-breaking rule (smaller array length, then arr1) needs careful implementation.
